meanings.definition: To convert or be converted into vapor.
meanings.sent2: The sun vaporises the morning dew.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made the coin vaporise into thin air!
meanings.sent4: Her smile vaporises all my worries.
meanings.sent5: The heat from the fire vaporises the ice instantly.

meanings.definition: To cause to disappear or dissipate.
meanings.sent1: The wind vaporises the clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent2: His explanation vaporises any doubts we had.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring seems to vaporise all tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter vaporises the silence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The kind words from a friend can vaporise sadness in an instant.

meanings.sent1: The ice cube slowly vaporises in the warm room.
meanings.sent2: The puddle vaporises under the heat of the sun.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate on the table seems to vaporise when no one is looking!
meanings.sent4: His confidence vaporises as soon as he steps on stage.
meanings.sent5: The morning mist vaporises as the sun rises higher in the sky.
